alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Crawford; Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 24 at 1:33AM CDT until September 24 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Benton, Carroll, Crawford, Madison and Washington AR. Portions of Oklahoma, including the following counties, Adair, Cherokee, Craig, Delaware, Haskell, Latimer, Le Flore, Mayes, McIntosh, Muskogee, Nowata, Okmulgee, Ottawa, Pittsburg, Pushmataha, Rogers, Sequoyah, Tulsa, Wagoner and Washington OK. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Clusters of strong thunderstorms will continue across portions of eastern Oklahoma and northwest Arkansas early this morning. 2 to 4 inches of rainfall has already fallen across portions of northeast Oklahoma and east-central Oklahoma and flooding is ongoing in some areas. Locally up to 6 inches will be possible across portions of east-central Oklahoma. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
